extended_metaphor.metaphor: both Double Helix in DNA and Blockchain in money have structural redundancy
extended_metaphor.double_helix: Utilizing two intertwined spirals to increase stability and redundancy in storing genetic information
extended_metaphor.blockchain: Blockchain technology employs a decentralized network of nodes to store multiple copies of the ledger, ensuring data redundancy and system stability.

extended_metaphor.metaphor: both Double Helix in DNA and Blockchain in money have efficient use of space
extended_metaphor.double_helix: Compact geometric configuration for high data density and efficient storage of genetic information
extended_metaphor.blockchain: Blockchain uses cryptographic hashes and data structure optimizations to achieve high data density, enabling efficient storage and retrieval of financial transactions.

extended_metaphor.metaphor: both Double Helix in DNA and Blockchain in money have modularity
extended_metaphor.double_helix: Encoding genetic information along the length of the strands allowing for easy separation during replication or protein synthesis
extended_metaphor.blockchain: Blockchain splits data into blocks that are linked together, enabling easy verification, validation, and updating of individual transactions without affecting the entire chain.
